Job Title: Mechanical Engineer PE/Project Manager (Design/Build)

Location: Bronxville, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Jobot, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

Mechanical Engineer PE/Project Manager (Design/Build) - Competitive Salary, Bonus, Benefits, Work/Life Balance!!!

This Jobot Job is hosted by: Tony Barhoum

Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.

Salary: $85,000 - $130,000 per year

A bit about us:

We are an Engineering Consulting firm specializing in MEP Engineering/Design, Energy Efficiency, and Commissions. Out projects include Commercial, Educational, Healthcare, Hospitality, Corporate, Research Facilities, and Residential projects. We put Quality First to serve our clients and support our employees with integrity and humility, displaying project leadership excellence unique to our Firm. We develop creative and effective solutions to meet our employee's and clients' needs, creating a culture that acknowledges achievements and encourages professional development while providing challenging project work and career Advancement.

Why join us?

 Competitive Base Salary! Competitive Bonus and Options Package! Complete Benefits Package! Flexible / Hybrid Work Schedules! Accelerated Career Growth!

Job Details

We are seeking a Mechanical Design Engineer/Project Manager to Join our Team. We are entertaining Sr. Project Engineers to Project Manager Level candidates. This person will be responsible for participating and leading the design and/or project management of mechanical building systems, preparing detailed mechanical engineering design calculations and drawings of mechanical systems, from schematics through construction administration, on a wide range of building types. The ideal candidate will have previous experience working with Engineering Consulting firm in NYC, experience performing Mechanical / HVAC Systems Design using AutoCAD or Revit. Projects consist of New and Existing facility upgrades for Commercial and Light industrial facilities, including Commercial & Residential High-Rises, Mid-Rises, Mixed Use, Higher Education, hotels, Life Sciences, Institutional, etc.

Qualifications

 Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering from ABET Accredited College or University  EIT or PE License Desired  6 - 8+ years of experience with an MEP or Engineering Consulting firm designing HVAC building systems on complex projects Proficient in Revit OR AutoCAD  Proven Project experience in Commercial, Public Sector, Educational (K-12 / Higher Education), Justice, and/or Civic Projects Develop HVAC designs from concept through completion of construction.  Coordinate HVAC design requirements with architecture, structure, and other disciplines. Prepare engineering design calculations and mechanical system layouts, and detailed engineering reports and narratives. Experience with direct client contact and fostering those relationships. Assist in developing project objectives, goals, and documentation policies. Support business development initiatives by assisting the RFP process and interview process. Actively engage in community and/or industry-specific organizations that will build the DLR Group brand.

Desired, Not Required

 Experience and interest in Sustainable Building Design LEED AP or LEED GA with previous experience participating in the LEED or other green rating system process. An appreciation and understanding of architectural design and how architects work and think.

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
